children.subject:
I'm just writing my response here since it is a personal opinion. I think it would still be better to take it in letter grade, in case when you want to pursue MS or PhD later in the future. If you have no interest in going to study more in grad school, then taking it P/NP wouldn't hurt though I think it could still have some impact when you are looking for a job since everything but theses two courses are in P that they may think you took it in P/NP because you weren't confident(? or any other word) enough. 

Well.. that's my opinion

history.content: I have no immediate plans for grad school (if any); I'd like to build/explore my career first. Will taking CS 170/EECS 127 P/NP affect me negatively when looking for jobs? I'm looking to take these 2 along with CS 189 and Math 128A my final semester purely for the knowledge, and do not want to worry about getting a good grade. Of course that doesn't mean I'll be slacking or simply not caring, as that would just be a waste of my time. It'd just take A LOT of pressure off my workload (which honestly is disgustingly high if all done for a letter grade). Does anyone recommend against this? Thanks.
history.subject: Taking CS 170 and EECS 127 P/NP
